sources.title: How The West Was Won (1962) Smilebox / Cinerama Version
sources.description: From covered wagons to railroads - the pioneers conquer the New World. A star-studded, episodic Western epic about the settlement of America.. In five episodes, directors John Ford , George Marshall , and Henry Hathaway recount the Prescott family's journey westward. They follow their fortunes over three generations, from the raft crossing the Ohio River to the trek to California's gold country, from the Civil War to the construction of the railroad. Dozens of stars ( Gregory Peck , James Stewart , John Wayne , Henry Fonda , and others) appeared, 400 technicians were on duty, and five Native American tribes participated, including the elderly Red Cloud, who had fought General Custer at Little Big Horn. The film was shot in the rare Cinerama format, with three cameras recording one image simultaneously. The film became a box office hit and won three Oscars for editing, sound, and screenplay. Spencer Tracy as Narrator

metadata.Plot: Setting off on a journey to the west in the 1830s, the Prescott family run into a man named Linus who helps them fight off a pack of thieves. Linus then marries daughter Eve Prescott (Carroll Baker), and 30 years later goes off with their son to fight in the Civil War, with bloody results. Eve's sister Lily heads farther west and has adventures with a professional gambler, stretching all the way to 1880s San Francisco.
metadata.Director: John Ford, Henry Hathaway, George Marshall
